FIGREF1.text: Fig. S2. The SosV-RBP loop 2L23 coordinates a putative calcium cation. (a) The FoFc difference map indicates the presence of a cation coordinated by the SosV-RBP loop 2L23 via the main chain carbonyl oxygen of residues Asp269, Thr272, and Gly274, and the side chains of Asp269, Thr272, and Glu276. A similar mechanism of stabilization of 2L23 through coordination of a calcium cation has been observed in several HN RBP structures, and loss of calcium inhibits activity in NDV-RBP [2]. The FoFc difference map is rendered at 2.0  and represented as mesh (green). (b)Fitting of a calcium ion (green) into loop 2L23 is consistent with the 2FoFc difference map. The 2FoFc electron density is rendered at 2.0  and displayed as mesh (blue). SosV-RBP is displayed in cartoon (gray) representation, with important residues and glycans displayed as sticks.Supplementary Fig. S3. The SosV-RBP hexapeptide motif region is structurally distinct to NDV-RBP and other HN-RBPs. SosV-RBP (gray) and NDV-RBP (white) (1E8V) [3] are shown in cartoon representation with the relevant side chains represented as sticks. N-Acetyl-2,3-dehydro-2deoxyneuramic acid (DANA) is shown as yellow sticks. Homologous residues are numbered according to SosV-RBP. In contrast to NDV-RBP, SosV-RBP residues Arg242, Leu243, and His245 impede into the putative sialic acid binding site. The side-chain of Lys236 in NDV-RBP has been observed to adopt different conformations between ligand-free and ligand-bound states [2], however, subsequent structural studies of other HN RBPs commonly show the above orientation [4-7]. Supplementary Fig. S4. The unique disulfide formed between Cys522 and Cys527 could contribute to the unique orientation of loop 5L23. Both SosV-RBP (gray) and NDV-RBP (white) (1E8V) are shown in cartoon representation with the relevant residues represented using sticks and colored according to atom. The conserved triarginyl motif of the SosV-RBP structure is disrupted, loop 5L23 bends outwards, away from the putative active site. The disulfide bond (Cys522Cys527) formed between 5S3 and 5S4 has not been observed in other paramyxovirus HN RBPs and may contribute to the structural displacement of residue Arg514 in SosV-RBP.
